title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Thursday 27 July 2017 - BBC News
summary: serving police officer in court charged with rape .
female security guard 'stabbed ' in supermarket car park .
huge ' amount of drugs seized in exmouth .
royal marine sentencing continues for terror offences .
'brutal ' broom handle murder : life sentence appeals thrown out .
agency costs 'fall by a quarter ' at south west hospitals and health trusts .
more than 30,000 people expected at mtv crashes plymouth .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on friday 28 july 2017 .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on friday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: port eliot festival : hidden surprises around every turn
text: there really is something hidden around every corner at port eliot festival .
beyond the orangery are walled gardens containing the art and wardrobe departments and more local food stalls .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: port eliot festival : oldest church in cornwall to host gigs
text: i 've headed into the sipsmith gin shop on the banks of the river tiddy .
pre-event crew members wendie and andy are relaxing after some hard work .
they 've just enjoyed a hot tub session on the banks of the river and are looking forward to seeing karl hyde and tom rogerson .
`` i 'm just really looking forward to being in that church , '' wendie said .
the church , next to the house , will serve as a music venue and is thought to be the oldest church in cornwall .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: author reveals father 's love letter secrets to bbc radio cornwall
text: author reveals father 's love letter secrets to bbc radio cornwall
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: taxpayers to shell out after pranksters turn camborne 's commercial square into foamy bubblebath
text: taxpayers will once again foot the bill after mindless pranksters turned a historic fountain into a foamy bubble bath .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: security guard 'stabbed in the leg '
text: a security guard was stabbed in the leg outside a supermarket in redruth , cornwall , police have said .
it happened in the morrisons ' car park on agar road , at about 13:00 on friday 14 july .
the female security guard was approached by a woman and two men in the car park .
officers said the woman was reported to have stabbed the security guard in the leg with a sharp implement before running off in the direction of a nearby estate .
police described the suspect as in her 20s , white , approximately 5ft 2ins tall , of a slight build , with shoulder length curly blonde hair , and wearing a blue tracksuit top and jeans .
anyone with information is asked to contact police .

documents.title: port eliot festival : down by the river
text: hidden on one site of the side is the river tiddy - where a few different activities are currently under way .
a forraging workshop is in full swing on the river bank , while wood powered hot tubs are welcoming visitors , with views across to the viaduct .

documents.title: plans approved for five-star hotel on plymouth waterfront
text: a five-star hotel in a prime location on plymouth 's waterfront has been given the green light despite concerns about the impact on the city 's historic landscape .
councillors have approved plans for the 11 storey , 80 bed hotel at a meeting this afternoon .
the developers , henley real estate limited , also have permission to build a 15 storey block of 88 residential apartments .
fifty-eight letters of representation against the £ 50m scheme were sent to the council .
they raised concerns about the buildings ' scale and design as well as the impact on nearby residents .

documents.title: port eliot festival : music in full swing
text: the papas and the mamas are currently playing on the caught by the river stage .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather watchers : cloudy skies captured
text: thanks to weather watchers keith , in porthtowan , and gram , in brixham , for sending in these weather snaps in .
there will be variable amounts of cloud overnight and many places will stay largely dry .
however , outbreaks of rain will start to edge into western cornwall in the early hours .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: man shot in face with paintball gun
text: a man was shot in the face at point blank range with a paintball gun during an argument over mislaid tobacco .
dwight read , 22 , from torpoint admitted assault by beating at bodmin magistrates court .
the court heard how he shot jamie andrews in the face , after the argument escalated on 28 june .
the pair started arguing via facebook 's messaging service , after read asked mr andrew if he had accidentally taken his tobacco .
after several messages were sent , mr andrews went to the car park outside read 's house , from where he shouted obscene abuse towards his flat .
read took a paintball gun and went outside to confront him , with the intention of deterring any violence , the court heard .
when faced with the weapon , mr andrew tried to grab it and some shots were discharged , causing injuries to his jawline and cuts to his upper lip .
read was ordered to pay £ 250 compensation , and the weapon is to be forfeited and destroyed .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: port eliot festival : trees decorated with waste plastic
text: these trees are decorated with plastics found on local beaches .
rame peninsula beach care is also running marine plastic art workshops at their stand at port eliot festival .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: stephen bull death : jury delivers verdicts
text: one man has been found guilty of murder and another guilty of manslaughter in connection with the death of homeless man stephen bull , whose body was found in a park in st austell in january .
joshua buscombe , 25 was found guilty of murder , while jordan bishop , 21 , was been found guilty of manslaughter .
a third man daniel altass , 22 , had previously pleaded guilty to murder .
sentencing will take place tomorrow at truro crown court .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: terror marine 'had 43 weapons hides '
text: a royal marine who made bombs for dissident republicans had 43 weapons hides across england and northern ireland , the old bailey has been told .
ciarán maxwell , originally from larne , county antrim , bought bomb-making materials online and posted them to his late grandmother 's house , it heard .
the 31-year-old has already admitted offences including bomb-making and storing stolen military weapons .
the london court hearing will determine the length of his jail sentence .

documents.title: man clogs up 999 system with calls before smashing entrance of exeter police station
text: a man clogged up the emergency services call centre with persistent 999 and 101 calls from a phone outside an exeter police station - before smashing in a door .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: wrong turn for driver who blocked kingsbridge road
text: there was no way through bell cross road in kingsbridge this afternoon after a driver took a detour that left his open-top sports car firmly wedged .
kingsbridge police reported that the road was temporarily closed while a recovery truck made its way to the stranded driver .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: port eliot festival : a town in a cornish field
text: how 's this for a high street ?
port eliot is like a makeshift town - there 's shops , restaurants , bars , venues - and even cash machines .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: breakingserving police officer in court charged with rape
text: a serving police officer has appeared in court charged with three counts of rape .
pc ryan canning , 44 , a plymouth-based officer from burraton coombe , saltash , was suspended from duty at the start of the investigation .
wearing a dark suit and tie , pc canning gave no indication of plea at bodmin magistrates court .
the case was adjourned to truro crown court on 25 august .
devon and cornwall police said it expects the highest standards from staff and `` will robustly investigate misconduct and alleged criminal offences '' .

documents.title: port eliot festival : dressed for the occasion
text: lorraine , who is working in one of the shops here at port eliot is getting some help getting into the festival spirit .
there is plenty of glitter , flower crowns and bright colours here , with the gardens of the estate decorated just as brightly as the people .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather update : isolated showers
text: showers will become heavier into the evening , but there will still be some prolonged sunny spells .
there will be variable amounts of cloud overnight and many places will stay largely dry .
however , outbreaks of rain will start to edge into western cornwall in the early hours .
author: Bee Tucker
BBC Weather

documents.title: 'up to £ 40,000 worth of drugs seized '
text: a huge amount of drugs have been seized by police in exmouth during a search earlier today .
the haul includes heroin , crack cocaine and cash .
officers from the devon and cornwall force say an early estimation of the value is thought to be in the region of £ 35,000 - £ 40,000 .

documents.title: port eliot festival : excitement over zandra rhodes
text: pat and brenda are here at port eliot for the third time .
both in their late 60s , pat said : `` it took us 50 years to go to a festival .
the atmosphere is absolutely fantastic here - you can do what you want .
`` we stay in a tent put up for us and we 're looking forward to all the music , crafts and talks .
we made stools last year , and were looking forward to seeing zandra rhodes . ''
the pair even confessed to having red wine in lucozade bottles in their rucksacks have a great time ladies !
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: student guilty of sexually abusing sleeping men
text: a man faces jail for sexually assaulting two fellow students as they slept .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: port eliot festival : it 's yoga time
text: i 'm just heading to the craft stalls and workshop area , but there 's already some yoga going on .
there are yoga and mediation workshops timetabled throughout the weekend .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: knife amnesty branded a success by police
text: a knife amnesty took place across devon and cornwall in mid-july with hundreds of knives handed in to police stations across the counties .
in north devon alone , 140 knives were handed in .
devon and cornwall police have branded the amnesty a success .
plymouth knife amnesty may have finished yesterday but still more than happy to take this off the street today # opsceptre # police

documents.title: launceston show takes place
text: the 2017 launceston agricultural show is taking place today .
looks like @ twitterid is making friends @ twitterid you 're missing all the fun @ twitterid
see ?
you do n't have to be taller than your sheep !
age is no barrier for this young # sheep enthusiast @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: travel update : expect slow traffic on tamar bridge
text: travel update : expect slow traffic on tamar bridge
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: port eliot 's push for local food
text: one of the big pulls about port eliot is the festival 's aim to have plenty of local , tasty food on site .
lee from st agnes is here bringing local seafood to campers all weekend .
there 's a whole host of stalls here - from persian street food to crepes and cakes .
i 'm just sitting down to one of lee 's cajun fish tacos .
yum !
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: decision on sherford development expected
text: plymouth planners will make a decision this afternoon about controversial changes to the new town of sherford on the edge of the city .
the prince 's foundation helped develop the design framework for the town , and claimed the developers , the sherford consortium , are reneging on promises to abide by the strict design rules .
the consortium has denied this .
the new town was initially due to contain 5,500 new homes , as well as schools , businesses and community facilities .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: port eliot festival : aaaannnd relax !
text: there is n't just music and food here blanca is here with the festival 's spa giving mobile massages around the site .
it 's all about rest and relaxation here - as well as soaking up the atmosphere and enjoying yourself .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: port eliot festival : come prepared for mud
text: the rain is n't constant at the moment but it 's showery .
i may have been a bit too optimistic with my choice of footwear
but fear not , most of the site is fine .
we 're not on glastonbury levels of mud quite yet !
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: choir helps ron find his voice again
text: choir helps ron find his voice again

documents.title: port eliot festival : tents going up
text: there 's a hive of activity at the port eliot estate as visitors are setting up camp .
a few events have already started , the food stalls are ready and festival-goers are settling in .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: port eliot festival : and we 're off !
text: it 's looking a little overcast here in st germans but there 's clearly a lot of excitement in the air .
a queue has formed at the main gate and we 're heading inside
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: fire boat name suggestions welcome
text: you ca n't call it boaty mcboatface but cornwall fire and rescue services wants your suggestions on a name for its new fire boat .
it will be used for larger boat fires and also protection during regattas .
the name needs to be short but with a cornish angle .
any thoughts ?
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: watch charli xcx sound check on mtv crashes plymouth stage
text: pop star charli xcx has been sound checking on the mtv crashes plymouth stage this morning .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: classic steam engine heading to cornwall
text: going over tamar bridge at 2pm ?
could be a steamy crossing as this traction engine heads to cornwall at 5mph # steam

documents.title: cat 'died from suspected poisoning '
text: the rspca is warning pet owners in st austell to be vigilant , after a cat died in the town from suspected poisoning .
felix was found in the high street with foam coming from his mouth .
it 's thought at least two other cats in the area have died in similar circumstances .
the rspca does n't know if the latest incident was an accident or a deliberate act , and is appealing for information .
suzanne norbury from the charity says people should keep antifreeze , pesticides and chemicals away from animals .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: more than 150 pupils attacked teachers in cornwall schools last year
text: more than 130 primary school pupils were excluded in cornwall last year for attacking teachers .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: marine ciarán maxwell sentencing continues
text: here 's a round-up of yesterday 's hearing
author: BBC News Northern Ireland

documents.title: woman who advertised 'death trap ' on airbnb told to pay almost £ 6,000
text: a woman advertised a `` potential death trap '' on airbnb when she breached fire regulations with toxic tiles , no emergency lighting , the wrong locks and a fire extinguisher that had n't been tested in 15 years .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: camborne murder : appeal rejected by judges
text: an appeal by two of the three people convicted of murdering camborne man , terry oldham in 2014 , has been rejected by judges .
the court heard testimony from aaron mallon who claimed he was by himself when he attacked mr oldham , saying he assaulted him for `` being a paedophile '' .
this led lawyers for michelle casterton and daniel quinn to argue this new evidence fatally undermined the safety of their convictions and wanted them quashed .
but judge ladyjustice hallett rejected this saying that mallon had only claimed he was the sole killer after abandoning his own appeal .
citing examples of mallon 's lying , the judge said his new evidence would not be admitted .
mr oldham , 63 , died after sustaining horrific injuries from sustained abuse by the trio who had moved into his home , bullied him and assaulted him with a broom handle .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: 'huge ' amount of drugs seized in exmouth
text: huge amount of heroin , crack cocaine & cash seized during search in # exmouth .
early estimate of total value £ 35-40k .
# drugs @ dc police
fantastic result - keeping our communities safe and pro actively targeting offenders
great work .

well done .
congrats , and thank you .
we do n't want exmouth to turn into torquay .
if you need anyone to look after the cash i do n't mind haha .
# disneyholiday # proceedsofcrime
author: Twitter

documents.title: agency costs 'fall by a quarter '
text: the cost of agency staff in the south west 's hospitals and mental health trusts dropped by a quarter in the last financial year , figures show .
however , many are still struggling to comply with a cap on agency spending , which was first introduced in 2015 .
in the last financial year agency spend was £ 76m , down from £ 100m the year before .
one scheme being piloted in devon to help reduce the agency spend is training healthcare assistants for a new role of nursing associates , just below the level of a registered nurse .
author: Jenny Walrond
Health Correspondent, BBC Spotlight

documents.title: 'why do people do this ? '
text: just some of the words uttered by bbc radio cornwall 's james churchfield as he tried out the latest £ 1m ride at helston theme park flambards .
skyforce is the latest attempt to pull in visitors .
it weighs 58 tonnes , locked in 100 tonnes of concrete .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: female security guard 'stabbed '
text: a security guard was stabbed in the leg outside a supermarket in redruth , cornwall , police have said .
it happened in the morrisons ' car park on agar road , at about 13:00 on friday 14 july .
the female security guard was approached by a woman and two men in the car park .
officers said the woman was reported to have stabbed the security guard in the leg with a sharp implement before running off in the direction of a nearby estate .
police described the suspect as in her 20s , white , approximately 5ft 2ins tall , of a slight build , with shoulder length curly blonde hair , and wearing a blue tracksuit top and jeans .
anyone with information is asked to contact police .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: school 'strongly refutes ' ofsted judgement
text: a free school has failed to enter any year 11 pupils into end-of-year examinations , in what inspectors called an `` unreasonable and unorthodox '' step .
the route 39 academy said its students were `` neither academically ready nor sufficiently mature or resilient '' to take gcses , according to an ofsted inspection .
the school in bideford , devon , said it `` strongly refutes '' the judgment of the inspection which deemed the school inadequate and placed it into special measures .
author: Press Association

documents.title: teignmouth carnival 'show must go on ' despite major fire
text: the teignmouth carnival procession on thursday evening will go ahead as planned , despite a fire forcing the closure of the beachcomber cafe and public toilets on the seafront .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: steam engine makes final journey
text: a veteran 108-year-old vehicle is making her way through devon today , on the last leg of her journey to a special festival .
iconic steam traction engine , the keeling , is heading to one of the south west 's biggest steam fairs , being held in cornwall , at the weekend .
she 'll be crossing the tamar bridge later today , 55 years after her first trip over it , just after it first opened in 1962 .
steam fans can see more of her at the boconnoc steam fair , just outside lostwithiel .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: high tide times for the region
text: if you 're planning a trip to the coast or seaside , here are the next high water times around devon and cornwall .
we 'll have the latest forecast on bbc spotlight at 13:30 .
author: Bee Tucker
BBC Weather

documents.title: boy rescued from tree
text: a boy has been rescued from a tree in plymouth by fire crews .
the 13-year-old was stuck in the tree in southway drive on wednesday evening .
a triple extension ladder was used to rescue him .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service said the teenager was not injured .

documents.title: thousands of music fans descend on plymouth
text: plymouth will host some of the biggest acts in music today as more than 30,000 fans are expected to descend on the hoe for mtv crashes .
the two-day festival will see acts such as busted , sigma , clean bandit and x factor winner , louisa johnson take to the stage .
it 's the fourth year the city has hosted the event .
the city council says it 'll be one of the music events of the summer , showcasing plymouth on tv channels across the world .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: man let youth use his flat for dealing drugs
text: a heroin user who allowed a teenage drug dealer to operate from his seafront flat is to be assessed for drug rehabilitation .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: latest weather : sunshine and scattered showers
text: a breezy day with sunshine and scattered blustery showers , some of which will be heavy at times , possibly with the odd rumble of thunder .
showers will become more isolated into the evening with some prolonged sunny spells .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: fire service rescue 13-year-old boy stuck in a tree
text: a 13-year-old boy needed help from the fire service last night after he became trapped in a tree .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: 'brutal ' broom handle murder : life sentence appeals thrown out
text: two people appealing their life sentences for the murder of camborne man terry oldham have had their applications thrown out of london 's court of appeal .

a third man , aaron mallon , who was also convicted now claims he was the sole killer which lawyers said undermined the safety of the convictions of 45-year-old michelle casterton and 25-year-old daniel john quinn .
however the senior judge rejected this .
mr oldham 's body was found `` covered with extensive injuries '' at the property in dolcoath road on 1 april 2014 .
they included the `` worst kind '' of internal infection , `` deep bruising '' to his sexual organs and thighs , four fractured ribs and broken fingers , a court heard .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: royal marine sentencing continues for terror offences
text: a hearing to decide the sentence of a royal marine from exminster , who pleaded guilty to fraud and terrorism offences is due to continue later at the old bailey .

yesterday the court heard that ciaran maxwell - who served with 40 commando in taunton - had more than a dozen hiding places for explosives , bomb making equipment and drugs around powderham and kenton .
the 31-year-old has previously admitted the preparation of terrorist acts for dissident republicans in northern ireland .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for thursday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport and travel for devon and cornwall today .
it 's a bit of a mixed bag weather-wise today - strong winds , some showers , and sunshine across the south west .
we 'll have weather updates through the day .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online
